frameDefinitions: A Speaker communicates a message stating an Item's membership in a Category, i.e., asserts that the Item has the defining characteristics of the Category.
A Communicator publically communicates some difficult-to-express Content which they (or a social group of which they are a member) have had for some time.
An Developer develops a Product, in some cases for a Company.    ''
This frame contains verbs and nouns that communicate the act of a Speaker to address a Message to some Addressee using language.
A Communicator communicates a judgment of an Evaluee to an Addressee.

A Communicator processes some information (either from textual or real-world/perceptual sources) regarding a State_of_affairs into a concise form (a summary) that contains the essential content in briefer form, and communicates this summary to an Addressee, or records it in a Medium.
frameExamples: He <t>depicted</t> his involvement as merely peripheral.
Those grievances can be <t>aired</t> during Board meetings. CNI
The <t>development</t> of a profitable product will be necessary for the company to stay afloat. INI
I now <t>declare</t> you members of this Society.
I <t>commended</t> his handling of the crisis.
Frank has already <t>summarized</t> some of the reactions on his weblog.
listRoleDefinitions: The individual that communicates the message concerning the <fen>Category</fen> of an <fen>Item</fen>.
The class of entities with characteristics that match those of the <fen>Item</fen> according to the portrayal of the <fen>Speaker</fen>.
The entity that the <fen>Speaker</fen> portrays as belonging to a <fen>Category</fen>.
The piece of text in which a <fen>Speaker</fen> communicates their categorization of the <fen>Item</fen>.
The point in time at which the <fen>Speaker</fen> makes a characterization of the <fen>Item</fen>.
The location at which the <fen>Speaker</fen> characterizes the <fen>Item</fen>
The <fen>Communicator</fen> is the person who expresses the <fen>Content</fen> (whether spoken or written).
The attitude or feeling that the <fen>Communicator</fen> had not previously expressed.
<fen>Medium</fen> is the observable action or product of the <fen>Communicator</fen>.
The time when the <fen>Content</fen> is communicated.
The role specifies the place where the communication takes place.
The person who develops the <fen>Product</fen>.
The entity which is developed by the <fen>Developer</fen>.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Product</fen> is developed by the <fen>Developer</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Product</fen> is developed by the <fen>Developer</fen>.

The <fen>Speaker</fen> is the sentient entity that produces the <fen>Message</fen> (whether spoken or written).  It is normally expressed as the External Argument of predicative uses of the <t>target	</t> word, or as the Genitive modifier of the noun.
The <fen>Message</fen> is the role that identifies the content of what the <fen>Speaker</fen> is communicating to the <fen>Addressee</fen>.  It can be expressed as a clause or as a noun phrase.
The <fen>Topic</fen> is the subject matter to which the <fen>Message</fen> pertains. It is normally expressed as a PP Complement headed by 'about', but in some cases it can appear as a direct object.
<fen>Medium</fen> is the physical entity or channel used by the <fen>Speaker</fen> to transmit the statement.
The <fen>Time</fen> at which the <fen>Message</fen> is made.
The role specifies the location where the <fen>Message</fen> takes place.
The <fen>Communicator</fen> uses language in the written or spoken modality to convey his or her evaluation of the <fen>Evaluee</fen> to another person.
<fen>Medium</fen> identifies the physical or abstract setting in which the evaluation is conveyed.
<fen>Topic</fen> identifies the entity to which the proposition or propositions conveyed relate.
A judgment is made about the <fen>Evaluee</fen>  With verbs this role is typically expressed as Object:
<fen>Expressor</fen> is the body part or action by a body part that conveys the judgment made by the <fen>Communicator</fen>.
Typically, there is a constituent expressing the <t>Reason</t> for the <fen>Communicator</fen>'s judgment. It is usually a <ment>for</ment>-PP.
When the communication of the judgment takes place.
Where the communication of the judgment takes place.
The <fen>Communicator</fen> creates and communicates the summary of the Information.
The <fen>State_of_affairs</fen> is summarized by the <fen>Communicator</fen>.
The textual or other <fen>Medium</fen> through which the <fen>Communicator</fen> summarizes.
The time at which the <fen>Communicator</fen> makes the <fen>Summary</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Communicator</fen> communicates.
listRoleExamples: However, <fex>'A Brief History of Medicine'</fex> characterizes influenza as the most deadly plague, overall.
<fex>Reagan</fex> gave voice to the innate patriotism of the American people.
Members aired <fex>their grievances</fex> and resented the way higher education was being dealt with.
I do not especially espouse the ideas articulated by Diana Plesa <fex>in her article</fex>.
Sometimes, children may <fex>later</fex> put into words a memory from early life, but not customarily.
John Ryan voiced concerns <fex>in Parliament</fex> about the suggestion that somehow the inquiry was not independent.
<fex>Elsa</fex> developed a new line of facial products.
<fex>Dr. Pepper</fex> was developed in Texas.
The development of unique, high-quality writing instruments <fex>in the late 1990s</fex> saved the company from going bankrupt.
Gabriela developed her new line of fashion <fex>in Milan</fex>.
<fex>Evelyn</fex> spoke feelingly about what happened.
Evelyn said <fex>that she was not ready to leave</fex>.
Evelyn spoke candidly <fex>about her past</fex>.
Kim preached to me <fex>over the phone</fex>.
In some remarks <fex>at the National Press Club</fex>, Mr. Keating said he would make a better prime minister tha nMr. Hawke.
<fex>Jon</fex> belittled Madie to her colleagues.
Jon belittled Madie <fex>over the telephone</fex>.
Jon criticized Madie <fex>about her managerial style</fex>.
Jon belittled <fex>Madie</fex> to her colleagues.
She viewed him with a critical <fex>gaze</fex>.
Jon extolled Madie <fex>for her efforts</fex>.
He received critical acclaim <fex>last week</fex>.
He was belittled by his long-time friend <fex>in front of his family</fex>.
